discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Uptime, UPS is a back power unit so uptime makes sense
ChatGPT and Google Bard both said its A. And with common sense it makes it the right answer.

questions.question_text: An engineer is gathering data to determine the effectiveness of UPSs in use at remote retail locations. Which of the following statistics can the engineer use to determine the availability of the remote network equipment?

A technician uses a badge to enter a security checkpoint on a corporate campus. An unknown individual quickly walks in behind the technician without speaking. Which of the following types of attacks did the technician experience?

discussion.content: This is like the 5th tailgating question but worded differently. CompTIA must have a tailgating issue at work.

A. Tailgating
Piggybacking is where an unauthorized individual gains access to an area once the authorized person allows them to enter. One example is holding the door open for someone, not knowing they are granting access to a potential threat.

Selected Answer: A
A - Tailgating is the right answer. I was thinking Piggybacking, but I believe that is when you use someone else's credentials to gain access. In this case you aren't using his credentials.

Selected Answer: B
for LR think Long Range

Selected Answer: B
A. 10GBASE-SW (MMF 984ft)
B. 10GBASE-LR (SMF 6 Miles)
C. 10GBASE-LX4 over multimode fiber (MMF 984ft) 
D. 10GBASE-SR (MMF 1000 ft)
I'll go with C, as in MMF mode it covers 550m
With 50 nano meter OM4 the length limit for 10GBase-SR is 550 meter, which is the what described in the question.

The network designer does not have internet connection to search for specifications. So, he has to choose 10-GBase-LR and know that 10-GBase-SR has range less than 550m (just miss, they could have rebuilt the building)

questions.question_text: A company is opening a new building on the other side of its campus. The distance from the closest building to the new building is 1,804ft (550m). The company needs to connect the networking equipment in the new building to the other buildings on the campus without using a repeater. Which of the following transceivers should the company use?

An AP uses a 98ft (30m) Cat 6 cable to connect to an access switch. The cable is wired through a duct close to a three-phase motor installation. Anytime the three-phase is turned on, all users connected to the switch experience high latency on the network. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Interference

The most likely cause of the issue is interference from the three-phase motor installation. Electrical motors, such as the three-phase motor mentioned, can generate electromagnetic interference (EMI) that affects nearby network cables. This interference can lead to high latency, packet loss, or other network issues. To mitigate this problem, consider rerouting the network cable away from the motor or using shielded twisted pair (STP) cables, which are designed to reduce the impact of electromagnetic interference.
I don't know what a three-phase motor is, but if it's right next to the cable, interference is almost certainly going to be your issue
BUZZ BUZZ BUZZ BUZZ BUZZ, you got da interference
ChatGPT and Google Bard both say it is A, and that is the most logical answer as well.

Selected Answer: A
A broadcast storm occurs when there is a high volume of broadcast traffic in a network, resulting in network congestion and performance degradation. In this case, the combination of old switches with low port rates and improper network configurations likely leads to the excessive generation and propagation of broadcast traffic. Over time, the continuous flow of broadcast messages overwhelms the network's capacity, causing it to become overwhelmed and eventually shutting it down.

questions.question_text: An IT technician installs five old switches in a network. In addition to the low port rates on these switches, they also have improper network configurations. After three hours, the network becomes overwhelmed by continuous traffic and eventually shuts down. Which of the following is causing the issue?
